I would like to be able to listen to my Kindle Fire books on the TV because of the superior sound.  Does anyone know how to do this?

review: I'm sure I'd like this product if I could get it to work with my display.  I have an older Panasonic AE900U projector which native resolution is 720p.  The projector also supports 1080i/60 but NOT 1080P.  When I plugged in my Fire TV initially the white Amazon logo appeared for about 10 seconds and then the screen started to flash on/off.  I could see some sort of graphics at the bottom of the screen.  I couldn't seem to get anywhere.  I connected the Fire TV directly to my projector same thing.  During this time the power LED would dim and brighten about every 2 seconds and at one point would turn orange.  I connected the network cable, let it boot, press all the keys on the remote until something happened (I think it updated the firmware). Now it will boot up and not flash but I only see a small portion of the display, like the top section of the screen has been stretched over the entire display.  The projector reports it's displaying 1080i/60.  I can't log into the my amazon account because I can't see the on screen keyboard.  I think there might be a menu option to manually set 720p but I can't get pack the login.  Very frustrating.  I've had no other problems connecting other devices to this projector over HDMI, blueray, dvd, playstation, xbox, cable box, computers, etc.Update:FYI - I this sounds unlikely but I believe my new FireTV killed my projector.  It was a Panasonic AE-900U that was about 7 years old with 4000 hours on it so I'm not that choked about it.  I've had probably close to 100 devices plugged into the projector over it's life through an HDMI switch, computers get plugged and unplugged daily without problem.  For some reason when the FireTV was first plugged in the projector didn't switch to it's native resolution of 720P, instead it tried to show the picture in 1080i (which the FTV doesn't support).  I could see the top half of the picture stretched over the entire height of the screen.  Unfortunately it was not possible to navigate to the settings menu on the FTV to try changing the resolution because the device wants to upgrade and make you sign in to your amazon account first.  Disappointed that it didn't work, I plugged my other devices back in one by one and nothing, no picture.  All the projector menus work and are displayed but no picture with any other device.  I plugged the FTV back in and same skewed picture.  I tried plugging the FTV and other devices directly into the projector with a short HDMI cable and same results.  It may have just been the projectors time to die, but it was very well maintained and I haven't had an issue with it until this point.  It's just too much of a coincidence that this was the first time plugging this new device into the projector.  I suspect the FTV HDMI is not completely running to backward compatible HDMI 1.0 specs, this confused the projector and hooped it.  Anyone else still using a Panasonic AE-900U with the ATV or have seen a similar issue?
